snippet: Measured by overall growth in the economy and by employment gains, the recovery from the recession that officially ended in June 2009 is roughly comparable to the recoveries that followed the two previous recessions. But the details are very...
lead_paragraph: Measured by overall growth in the economy and by employment gains, the recovery from the recession that officially ended in June 2009 is roughly comparable to the recoveries that followed the two previous recessions. But the details are very different. This recovery has been largely based on private sector investment and hiring, and has been held back by reductions in government spending and employment. Consumer spending has grown more slowly than in previous recoveries, and the home building industry is barely holding its own.
